alert.note: Alert for Dallas (Texas) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Warning issued October 26 at 7:05AM CDT until October 26 at 10:30PM CDT by NWS Dallas-Fort Worth
info.description: ...The Flood Warning continues for the following rivers in Texas... West Fork Trinity River At Grand Prairie affecting Dallas and Tarrant Counties. Elm Fork Trinity River Near Carrollton affecting Dallas County. Walnut Creek Near Mansfield affecting Tarrant County. ...The Flood Warning is extended for the following rivers in Texas... Rowlett Creek Near Sachse affecting Dallas County. ...Observed flooding changed from Minor to Moderate severity and increased in duration for the following rivers in Texas... White Rock Creek Near White Rock Creek At Greenville Ave affecting Dallas County. ...FLOOD WARNING NOW IN EFFECT UNTIL LATE THIS EVENING... * WHAT...Minor flooding is forecast. * WHERE...Elm Fork Trinity River near Carrollton. * WHEN...Until late this evening. * IMPACTS...At 9.0 feet, Minor flooding will occur upstream from the gage, near the city golf course. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 6:15 AM CDT Thursday the stage was 8.8 feet. - Bankfull stage is 8.0 feet. - Flood stage is 9.0 feet. - Forecast...The river is expected to rise above flood stage this morning to a crest of 9.2 feet late this morning. It will then fall below flood stage late this morning. &&
info.instruction: Do not drive cars through flooded areas. Caution is urged when walking near riverbanks. Additional information is available at www.weather.gov/fwd.
